alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 12:26AM MST until March 16 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Arizona... Verde River above Clarkdale affecting Yavapai County. For the Verde River...including Clarkdale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Verde River above Clarkdale. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, High flow could lead to bank erosion and water ponding in backwater catch basins. At 12.0 feet, Nuisance flooding of property along riverbanks. At 15.0 feet, Inundation of homes along Bates Road and Rio Verde RV park in Cottonwood begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM MST Thursday the stage was 15.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 AM MST Thursday was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river could crest at 15 feet later tonight. It will fall below flood stage by tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 08/01/2010. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Verde River Clarkdale 12.0 15.5 Thu 12 am MS 8.7 4.8 3.8 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz
